noun.description: A person who or thing which stands in the place of another; specifically (a) a sign, a symbol; (b) a person who represents another person or a wider group; a representative.
A person who or thing which depicts or portrays something. rare.
Law. A person who makes a representation; (in later use especially) a person who makes a statement on which reliance is placed in the concluding of a contract.

origin: Mid 16th century. From represent + -or. Compare earlier representer.
